title: My grandpa recently died. I don't feel anything since I barely knew him. Is that normal? - Quora

response.answer_text: dont be too harsh to yourself, it would be quite normal since you barely know him. just image that maybe you are a adopted child and your foster parents conceal this truth, so if your birth parents who you never meet died should you feel sorrow. we feel sadness to the things or people that have connection with us, sometimes a dog passed away will make us very frustrating. its not about Consanguinity,its about the memory , the time spending together, the connection

I have never felt anything for anyone who died, so from my point of view that’s pretty normal. I don’t think most people would find that normal though. I read a comment on here once where someone was saying they were “naturally” upset because their neighbour died. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
